name: Variable
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
Variable
description:
Variable

Represents a variable or an argument possibly of a compound object type. Note how the following variables are represented:

A simple Variable:

  x = 5
  # Captured variable:
  # { name: "x", value: "5", type: "Integer" }

A Compound Variable:

  class T
    attr_accessor :m1, :m2
    ...
  end
  v = T.new(1, "2")
  # Captured variable:
  # {
  #   name: "v",
  #   type: "T",
  #   members: [
  #     { name: "@m1", value: "1", type: "Integer" },
  #     { name: "@m2", value: "2", type: "String" }
  #   ]
  # }

A Hash object:

  hash = { a: 1, b: :two }
  # Captured variable:
  # {
  #   name: "hash",
  #   type: "Hash",
  #   members: [
  #     { name: "a", value: "1", type: "Integer" },
  #     { name: "b", value: ":2", type: "Symbol" }
  #   ]
  # }

An Array object:

  ary = [1, nil]
  # Captured variable:
  # {
  #   name: "ary",
  #   type: "Array",
  #   members: [
  #     { name: "[0]", value: "1", type: "Integer" },
  #     { name: "[1]", value: "nil", type: "NilClass" }
  #   ]
  # }

methods.name: from_rb_var
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
Variable.from_rb_var
methods.description: Convert a Ruby variable into a Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable object. If a variable table is provided, it will store all the subsequently created compound variables into the variable table for sharing.

examples.caption: Simple variable conversion
examples.code:
x = 3.0
var = Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable.from_rb_var \
        x, name: "x"
var.name  #=> "x"
var.value #=> "3.0"
var.type  #=> "Float"

examples.caption: Hash conversion
examples.code:
hash = {a: 1.0, b: :two}
var = Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable.from_rb_var \
        hash, name: "hash"
var.name  #=> "hash"
var.type  #=> "Hash"
var.members[0].name  #=> "a"
var.members[0].value #=> "1.0"
var.members[0].type  #=> "Float"
var.members[1].name  #=> "b"
var.members[1].value #=> ":two"
var.members[1].type  #=> "Symbol"

examples.caption: Custom compound variable conversion
examples.code:
foo = Foo.new(a: 1.0, b: [])
foo.inspect  #=> "#<Foo:0xXXXXXX @a=1.0, @b=[]>"
var = Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable.from_rb_var \
        foo, name: "foo"
var.name  #=> "foo"
var.type  #=> "Foo"
var.members[0].name  #=> "@a"
var.members[0].value #=> "1.0"
var.members[0].type  #=> "Float"
var.members[1].name  #=> "@b"
var.members[1].value #=> "[]"
var.members[1].type  #=> "Array"

examples.caption: Use variable table for shared compound variables
examples.code:
hash = {a: 1.0}
ary = [hash, hash]
var_table = Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::VariableTable.new
var = Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable.from_rb_var \
        ary, name: "ary", var_table: var_table
var.name            #=> "ary"
var.var_table_index #=> 0
var_table[0].type   #=> "Array"
var_table[0].members[0].name            #=> "[0]"
var_table[0].members[0].var_table_index #=> 1
var_table[0].members[1].name            #=> "[1]"
var_table[0].members[1].var_table_index #=> 1
var_table[1].type #=> "Hash"
var_table[1].members[0].name #=> "a"
var_table[1].members[0].type #=> "Float"
var_table[1].members[0].value #=> "1.0"

params.name: source
params.description: Source Ruby variable to convert from

params.name: depth
params.description: Number of levels to evaluate in compound variables. Default to Google::Cloud::Debugger::Breakpoint::Variable::MAX_DEPTH

params.name: var_table
params.description:
A variable table
to store shared compound variables. Optional.

params.name: limit
params.description:
Maximum number of bytes this conversion
should take. This include nested compound member variablesâ€™
conversions.

methods.name: set_error_state
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
Variable#set_error_state
methods.description: Set this variable to an error state by setting the status field

methods.name: total_size
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
Variable#total_size
methods.description: Calculate the total bytesize of all the attributes and that of the member variables, plus references into other variables in the variable table.

returns.description: The total payload size of this variable in bytes.

methods.name: payload_size
title: Google
Cloud
Debugger
Breakpoint
Variable#payload_size
methods.description: Calculate the bytesize of all the attributes and that of the member variables.

returns.description: The total payload size of this variable in bytes.
